thread.title: Beau Ryan addresses cheating accusations on The Footy Show
thread.title_full: Beau Ryan addresses cheating accusations on The Footy Show

author: Kate Aubusson and Tom Decent
title: Beau Ryan addresses cheating accusations on The Footy Show
text:
Click to play video Return to video Video settings Please Log in to update your video settings
Video will begin in 5 seconds.
Don't play Play now More video Recommended Replay video Return to video Video settings Please Log in to update your video settings
Beau Ryan's heartfelt moment Beau Ryan took a moment at the top of Nine's The Footy Show to thank his fans for their support and request that people continue to respect his privacy.
PT0M35S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-43re8 620 349 October 1, 2015 - 9:25PM Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings Beau Ryan back at work with the Footy Show after cheating claims Footy Show denies rumours star has been dismissed Affair revelations shatter Beau Ryan's squeaky-clean media image Beau Ryan dropped from Woolworths ad Beau Ryan has briefly addressed the cheating accusations made against him in the first few minutes of The Footy Show's NRL grand final special on Thursday night. 
Ryan emerged from the smokey stage for the live broadcast, returning three weeks after reports of an affair with former Hi-5 star Lauren Brant threatened to curtail his television career.
Lauren Brant and Beau Ryan during rehearsals for Aladdin and his Wondrous Lamp . Photo: Facebook/LaurenBrant 
"Firstly I just want to apologise to all the people who've been hurt recently," Ryan said as the broadcast kicked off.
Advertisement "It's been really, really hard for myself and my family," Ryan told his co-hosts, "...everyone involved."
"I'm not here to talk about my private life," he said before thanking those who respected his privacy.
Beau Ryan addressing cheating accusations on The Footy Show . Photo: Channel Nine 
"I'd love for people to continue to do that," he said.
"But I'm not here to talk about my private life ... I'm here to talk about a grand final," he said to cheers from the arena crowd.
"I'm just happy to be back," he said.
Beau Ryan and his co-costs on The Footy Show . Photo: Channel Nine 
@NRLFootyShow it's good to see beau Ryan again!! Footy show was incomplete without him
— Candice ツ (@divarko) October 1, 2015 Initial reports suggested Ryan had been stood down from  The Footy Show  for the rest of the year after it was revealed he cheated on his childhood sweetheart and wife of three years, Kara Orrell. 
Ryan was spotted filming a pre-recorded segment in Townsville for The Footy Show's grand final show on Tuesday.
The scandal cost Ryan dearly, after he was dropped from his role as a brand ambassador for Woolworths following the allegations.
I dunno how I feel about #BeauRyan @NRLFootyShow 
— Stephie (@StephanieColosi) October 1, 2015 But Channel Nine have thrown the former NRL star a lifeline by giving him the chance to return to the show and continue filming his popular segments. 
Ryan, 30, has spent the past few weeks overseas with his family, including his two-year-old daughter Remi, trying to sort out his marital problems which became public after Brant's former fiance, Warren Riley, told  Woman's Day  magazine how his partner was cheating on him with Ryan. 
Riley learned of the affair - which is said to have taken place when the pair were working on the Sydney production of  Aladdin and his Wondrous Lamp  - while he and Brant were in New Zealand. 
"I've been away addressing some personal issues," Ryan told News Limited. 
"Since returning from a holiday [in America] I have been overwhelmed by the support we have received.
"I'm very much looking forward to getting back to work on Thursday with the rest of the guys."
